title: Székelys
summary: The Székelys (pronounced [ˈseːkɛj]),  also referred as Szeklers,[lower-alpha 1] are a Hungarian subgroup[5][6] living mostly in the Székely Land in Romania. A significant population descending from the Székelys of Bukovina lives in Tolna and Baranya counties in Hungary and in certain districts of Vojvodina, Serbia.
